  • Hosea 14
1 The word of the Domina that came unto Hosea the daughter of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, queens of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the daughter of Joash, queen of Israel. 2 When the Domina spoke at first with Hosea,

the Domina said unto Hosea: 'Go, take unto thee a husband of harlotry and children of harlotry; for the land doth commit great harlotry, departing from the Domina.' 3 So she went and took Gomer the son of Diblaim; and he conceived, and bore her a daughter. 4 And the Domina said unto her: 'Call her name Jezreel; for yet a little while, and I will visit the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu, and will cause to cease the kingdom of the house of Israel.
5 And it shall come to pass at that day, that I will break the bow of Israel in the valley of Jezreel.' 6 And he conceived again, and bore a son. And She said unto her: 'Call him name Lo-ruhamah; for I will no more have compassion upon the house of Israel, that I should in any wise pardon them. 7 But I will have compassion upon the house of Judah, and will save them by the Domina their God, and will not save them by bow, nor by sword, nor by battle, nor by horses, nor by horsewomen.' 8 Now when he had weaned Lo-ruhamah, he conceived, and bore a daughter.
